intro: Achyrocome ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous achyrocome, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
